review: The Amazon Fire TV Stick is really easy to set up, especially on a new network, which is great because I got it for travel. If you have an Amazon account it enriches your experience, but other apps are good on it too such as HBO Go. I like the interface and how well it works with my photos & music. It is a much different media displaythan my Roku 3 and I like that, maybe not better, just different.Tip: My 1st Fire TV Stick had problems connecting to my home network and the remote skipped all over, but after troubleshooting failed exchanging it from Amazon it works well & they were very nice. Mine seems to work better using the HDMI extender all the time. Take the updates when they come to prevent slowdown and you'll be fine. Also you should be able to power it from your TV's USB, which I think is necessary as the cable is usually too short to reach an outlet. Loses 1 star for short power cable and small app selection (though this may change).
